title: The Ethereum 2.0 Journey: From Beacon to Eternity - Finextra
summary:
The Ethereum 2.0 journey has entered a new phase with the Beacon Chain launch in December 2020, marking the beginning of the transition from the proof-of-work (PoW) consensus algorithm to the proof-of-stake (PoS) algorithm. The Merge, which occurred on September 15, 2022, further advanced the Ethereum 2.0 journey by integrating the Beacon Chain with the normal Ethereum blockchain, creating a parallel blockchain that runs on PoS.

The upcoming Shanghai upgrade, scheduled for April 12, 2023, is a significant improvement to the Ethereum network, bringing enhanced scalability, improved security, and better support for smart contracts and decentralized applications. The upgrade will allow validators to withdraw their staked Ether from the Beacon Chain to the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM), the environment where smart contracts are executed.

Additionally, the upgrade will introduce several new technologies and protocols, including proto-danksharding, a new virtual machine called eWASM, and further upgrades

title: Cardano Users Can Soon Access Ethereum Dapps Directly From ADA Wallets - CoinDesk
summary:
Sure! Here's a summary of the financial news in less than 256 tokens:

title: Analysts debate the ETH price outcomes of Ethereum's upcoming Shapella upgrade - Cointelegraph
summary: The Ethereum Foundation will deploy the Shapella upgrade on April 12, enabling withdrawals from Ethereum 2.0 staking contracts. The upgrade will impact ETH sell pressure, with some analysts predicting significant selling in the first few days after deployment. However, as more users move to stake ETH due to reduced risk and increased yields, market conditions may favor more upside in the long term. The Nansen report estimates that 59% of illiquid deposits are in profit, and total selling pressure could range from 1.2 million to 3 million ETH. The upgrade will implement a two-tier partial and full withdrawal system, with a minimum staking requirement of 32 ETH. The selling pressure is expected to peak in the first three days, with around $527 million in daily selling pressure. The ETH/USD pair faces resistance at $1,970, and a breakout above this level could see the pair reach bullish targets around $2,330 and $2,750. However, support lies around $1,569 in case of a downturn

title: How to Use the New Infura Sepolia Faucet for Ethereum Smart Contract Testing - hackernoon.com
summary: Infura has launched a new faucet for Ethereum smart contract testing, called Sepolia. The faucet provides a simple and easy-to-use interface for testing and debugging smart contracts, without the need for expensive hardware or complex software setup. Users can easily deploy and interact with their own test networks, and the faucet also includes a built-in gas tracker for tracking gas usage and costs. To use the faucet, users can simply visit the Sepolia website and follow the on-screen instructions to get started.

title: Ethereum's Gradual Approach to Enduring Value - Wealth Management
summary:
Ethereum, one of the most popular blockchain networks, is undergoing an upgrade that could significantly improve its investment flexibility. The Shanghai upgrade, expected to be released in September 2022, will allow users to access their staked ETH and rewards at any time, reducing capital risk and making it more enticing for institutional investors. This upgrade is seen as a game changer for the network, as it will provide more liquidity and potentially drive growth in the cryptocurrency industry.

The upgrade is part of Ethereum's broader effort to improve functionality and scalability, following the successful merge of its proof-of-work and proof-of-stake consensus layers in 2022. The network's large and active community, over 2,000 weekly active developers, and its ability to continuously improve its features are seen as a powerful catalyst for innovation.

Ethereum is now at a similar stage of development as the internet was in 1995 or the iPhone was in 2007, with powerful capabilities and uncharted possibilities at the juncture of mainstream adoption. The network'

title: Layer-2 project exec zooms in on the capabilities of Ethereum scaling solutions - Cointelegraph
summary: Elena Sinelnikova, co-founder of Metis, a layer-2 scaling solution built on Ethereum, discusses the platform's capabilities and potential impact on decentralization, scalability, and real-world applications. Metis leverages layer-2 technology to overcome Ethereum's limitations, including high gas fees, congestion, and slow transaction times. Sinelnikova believes that lower fees are crucial for enterprise-level use cases. The platform aims to empower individuals and businesses to create, manage, and scale decentralized autonomous organizations (DAOs), fostering a more inclusive and transparent decentralized economy. Sinelnikova also emphasizes the importance of education for crypto adoption and highlights the future developments of Metis. Listen to the full episode on Spotify, Apple Podcasts, Google Podcasts, or TuneIn.

title: Crypto Whales Move Over $600,000,000 in Bitcoin, Ethereum, XRP and The Sandbox – Here’s Where It’s Going - The Daily Hodl
summary: Crypto whales moved over $600 million in Bitcoin, Ethereum, XRP, and The Sandbox in a two-day period. The largest transaction involved an unknown wallet sending 409 million SAND worth over $247 million to another unknown wallet. Other notable transactions included an unknown wallet transferring 72,591 ETH worth over $125 million and a separate unknown whale sending 5,200 Bitcoin worth over $140 million to a different unknown address. XRP whales and exchanges also moved the crypto asset in smaller transactions.

title: $852,000,000 in Ethereum, Polygon, Fantom and Additional Altcoins Have Left Binance Following CFTC Lawsuit: Nansen - The Daily Hodl
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

$852 million in various cryptocurrencies, including Ethereum, Polygon, Fantom, and others, have left Binance following a lawsuit from the US Commodities Futures Trading Commission (CFTC). This outflow occurred within 24 hours of the news. Binance currently holds over $62 billion in assets, according to Nansen. The CFTC has charged Binance and its CEO with violating regulations, and the exchange's CEO has responded, disputing the allegations.

title: Bitcoin vs Ethereum Price Prediction, Experts believe RenQ will give profits - Hindustan Times
summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum prices are volatile, with predictions for 2023 ranging from $10,000 to $100,000 and $100 to $500, respectively. RenQ Finance (RENQ) is an altcoin with better profit potential, according to experts, due to its innovative features, low transaction fees, and strong community support. The platform aims to provide institutional-grade liquidity to the DeFi market and has the potential to see significant price growth in the coming years. However, investing in cryptocurrency is risky, and readers are advised to do their own research and carefully consider the risks before investing.

title: Zero-knowledge Rollups Get Cheaper With Scale - Blockworks
summary: Zero-knowledge rollups, a breakthrough in crypto technology, can significantly lower transaction costs on the Ethereum blockchain. These rollups offload the computation and execution of smart contracts to a separate layer-2 blockchain, allowing for more efficient use of Ethereum blockspace. The costs of writing data to mainnet from a zk rollup actually decrease as the number of users increases, unlike Ethereum mainnet where more users and transactions lead to increased gas fees. Current zk rollups do not charge fees in a native token but instead use ether, and the specifics of the rollup implementation determine what gets posted back to Ethereum mainnet. There is a competition between systems that emulate the EVM as close as possible and those that optimize proving for a particular VM, and technological and hardware improvements will reduce data availability costs further.

title: Ethereum's RocketPool (RPL) Plunges 12% as Major Holder Allegedly Suffers Multimillion Dollar Phishing Attack - U.Today
summary: RocketPool (RPL) plunged 12% after a major holder was allegedly hit by a multimillion-dollar phishing attack. The attacker withdrew 85,900 RPL from "poap.eth" and exchanged them for Ethereum (ETH), worth $3.8 million. The address likely belongs to the founder of the POAP protocol, Patricio Worthalter. The stolen RPLs were scattered across different addresses and 17 ETH were sent to Binance. The sale caused RPL to lose its positive price action of recent days, falling to $43 per token before recouping some of its fall. The incident has not been commented on by Worthalter or POAP.

title: Cardano (ADA) to Become Largest EVM Chain Thanks to This Killer Innovation - U.Today
summary: Cardano (ADA) to become largest EVM chain with new feature allowing direct use of EVM contracts from any wallet, making it one of the largest EVM networks in terms of user base size. Milkomeda to launch staking rewards for EVM users, including smart contract developers. Some users unhappy with development, viewing it as making life easier for lazy developers who don't want to learn Cardano's native programming languages. Developer also notes growing activity on Milkomeda network related to adoption of Paima Engine, a blockchain gaming innovation.

title: Who was front-running Binance users? - Cointelegraph
summary: A mystery entity has been consistently buying cryptocurrencies before they are listed on Binance, making a profit of over $1.4 million. Binance founder Changpeng Zhao has confirmed that the exchange froze $2 million associated with the address in question, but did not say whether Binance employees were involved. The on-chain data shows that the entity made a 7-figure profit through front-running Binance listings. However, it is unclear whether insider trading laws apply to this situation, as non-securities investments are not regulated by the SEC or any other regulatory body. Proving that the information was illegally acquired is also difficult, as cryptocurrency regulation is ambiguous and the SEC has difficulty proving whether cryptocurrencies are securities.

title: Why Pirate Nation Is Leaving Polygon and Setting Sail Towards Arbitrum Nova - Decrypt
summary:
Sure! Here's a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Pirate Nation, a role-playing game on Ethereum, is moving to Arbitrum Nova due to scaling issues on Polygon. The game's developer, Proof of Play, wants to simplify the Web3 experience for players without adding friction. Pirate Nation is almost entirely on-chain and operates via automated smart contracts, but the team is cautious about adopting new technologies like zero-knowledge scaling networks. Instead, the game is using its own tech solution called "mirroring" to move assets between chains. The migration is expected to be seamless for users, and the game is building an on-chain game engine and numerous smart contracts to operate its mechanics.

title: Ethereum Analysis: Strong Bearish Signal Indicates a Drop Blow $1,500 - Coinfomania
summary: Ethereum prices have been showing a gradual decline in buying volume, with a near equilibrium in buying and selling pressure. Indicators such as Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) show a bearish convergence, potentially leading to a massive downtrend in the coming days.

title: Nearly 90% of Ethereum Supply Now Held Off Crypto Exchanges - Investors King Ltd
summary: Nearly 90% of Ethereum's supply is now held off crypto exchanges, according to Investors King Ltd. This means that a large portion of Ethereum's total supply is not available for trading on exchanges, which can impact its price and liquidity. The article highlights the potential benefits of trading Ethereum in Nigeria, including the ability to make quick profits, access to a global market, and the ability to bypass traditional financial institutions. It also provides a step-by-step guide on how to sell Ethereum for cash in Nigeria using a crypto trading app called Breet.
